Reviews.Title: Good minimalistic phone
Reviews.Author: logikal2
Reviews.Content: I wanted a simple phone for making occasional calls and texts. This phone is it.If you're looking for a phone that does apps/games/music/web surfing, then you're better off getting a smart phone.The call quality has been good for me. Make sure to check AT&T;'s coverage map, because results will vary.This phone has an easy-to-use interface and allows for plenty of customization. The silver disc supports 4 custom shortcuts, and the "Go To" button supports 12 shortcuts. Even without shortcuts, you're still only a few clicks away from most menu options.The camera is good enough for setting a custom wallpaper, but don't expect to win any photography awards. This phone wasn't build to handle a lot of media. It supports up to 27 photos at 640x480 (the highest resolution), and about 200 photos with the average setting.I especially like the Alarm. You can set alarms that span certain days (e.g. one for weekdays, one for weekends, one for M-W-F).The phone has a MicroUSB port, which could allow you to charge your phone from your computer (the phone ships with a wall charger).For those concerned with health risks, this phone has a very low SAR rate (0.24 W/kg at the ear). It's well below the federal limit of 1.6 W/kg.Again, this phone does not have a lot of bells-and-whistles, but it works well. With occasional use (~ 300 minutes or less per month), it will end up saving a lot of money over a contract plan.

Reviews.Title: Good value for money
Reviews.Author: Gadget-Guru
Reviews.Content: If you deduct the 15$ airtime credit from the price you get good value for your money. The phone is basic, but really good for voice calls and text messages. The cover is made from durable plastic. If the display is difficult to read in bright sunshine you might try increasing the brightness of the display. In case you are looking for the SIM PIN: it is 1111 on att gophones. The phone is very leight and the battery really lasts long. So do compare the amazon.com product description with the net price (20$) you are paying. If you expect a camera with a higher resolution or any other big feature you have to look for another phone.

Reviews.Title: Nothing Special
Reviews.Author: J. D. Andersen "Jim"
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a simple phone without all of the bells and whistles.  The Samsung A 197 pretty much qualifies.  As I use a prepaid plan w/o any data options there are a lot of features to this phone I would never use, but they are there for those who want them.Pros:  The hinges for the clam shell design are solid.  Standby time is acceptable, but not really anything special.  Sound quality and voice quality are good.Cons:  Hands free options are Blue Tooth or Samsung's own ear bud/microphone system.  As the connection is a micro USB, other ear bud connectors are not going to work.  The speaker phone is total crap.  With speaker volume as high as it will go, it is almost impossible to hear the person on the other end.  Pretty much limits the hands free options to Blue Tooth.I did receive the $15 airtime credit and there was absolutely no problems with using A T & T's online setup.  The airtime credit is 90 days instead of the normal 30 days for that amount of money.

Reviews.Title: An Old Fogey Buys His First Cell Phone
Reviews.Author: jerry i h
Reviews.Content: (OK, you can stop laughing now. To answer your next question, mid 50's. For the following, I keep saying `minutes', but of course I mean $$$, and how many minutes it gives you depends on the GoPhone plan you choose)The impetus for buying this was: I had forgotten how expensive a bunch of long distance phone calls cost over a landline. There was a family tragedy, and for the phone bills I racked up, I coulda bought several of these GoPhone thingies, so I finally decided to get one.For the rather modest price tag, compared to a 2 year contract, you get all the accessories you need plus free airtime, so I consider this to be a great deal and give it highest recommendation. I remind you, however, that this is an old school "dumb" phone.OUT OF THE BOXBesides the phone, you get a SIM card, battery, AC charger, and included minutes, so you are good to go right out of the box. I had never seen a SIM card before, so it took me a minute to figure out how to punch it out and insert it into the phone. The factory settings for the display were no good, so I had take the brightness and screen idle time and set them to max. The best part was the minutes: once the phone was charged, you call a number listed in the quick start guide, and in less than half an hour I got my first text message telling me my minutes were activated; how cool is that? ICYW, this text message was free.IT IS A CELL PHONEIt has number buttons, and call button, and an end call button (the latter 2 double as power on and off). If you are like me, you will ignore all the other functionalities (well, you might wanna figure out how to access the stored numbers function; also how to turn off the audible ring), since I find navigating through complicated menus with only 2 buttons to be really, really annoying.IGNORING THE FEATURESFor a budget phone and a budget calling plan, you get access to a surprising number of advanced features: WAP, Apps, and email, all designed, of course, to burn through your minutes. I have ignored these, and cannot tell you anything about them. I also ignore the texting function, since I find creating letters with a numeric keypad as tedious and fiddly (yes, I know: teenagers can do this with patience and aplomb, besides being much faster than me).CAMERAThe only feature I appreciate is the integral VGA camera, mainly because it is a dedicated keyboard button and is therefore easy to access. You take pictures, which are stored in the non-volatile memory (no, I have no idea how many pictures it can store); if it is a particularly good one, you can set it as wallpaper. They display just fine on the screen. There are no external cards or plugs, so the only way to get pictures out of the phone is to email it to yourself; I have not done this yet, so cannot tell you how the pictures look on a regular computer screen.AIIIEEE...AT&T; COVERAGEAlthough I live in a major metropolitan market (SF/Bay Area), I have already experienced my share of dropped calls and/or not enough bars. So, if reliable coverage is important to you, I suggest you look for a phone with Verizon coverage.10¢ A MINUTEI make some phone calls, but they are usually very short, so I chose this option: for my use, it is just as cheap as the old calling cards. If you are a heavy user, there is also a $2 per day GoPhone option, which gives you unlimited airtime for one day; if you can manage to stay off the phone for a day, you do not get charged for that day, a much better deal than your typical 2 year cell contract.There is also one quirk you need to know: the minutes expire. Every time you finish a call, you get a message about how many minutes you have left and when they expire, so if you use it regularly, this is not a problem.IS IT TOUGH AND DURABLE?For me, this will never be an issue. It spends most of its life on a table next the landline phone for use for long distance calls (I use it so infrequently, I have never had to recharge it beyond the initial charge I gave it when I first opened the box). I do not take it with me every day when I leave the house. I do take it with me, but only once it in a while.

Reviews.Title: Good value
Reviews.Author: dutchybunny
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone because I needed a Bluetooth compatible phone.  The phone is compatible with the Bluetooth in my car.  I have not tried it with an ear bud.  The phone is simple to use and has all the basic features of a cell phone.  I do not know if the text messaging works as I do not text.  There are plenty of fancier cell phones on the market but if you need a basic, inexpensive, blue tooth phone, this is the phone for you.  I am very pleased with this phone and I would purchase this phone again.

Reviews.Title: Excellent and Simple and Great with Bluetooth Headset
Reviews.Author: Scott
Reviews.Content: I am on the phone over 1500 minutes a month, most of the time on conference calls and from anywhere. I use a Plantranics noise-cancelling Bluetooth headset. My carrier is ATT. The sound quality is excellent both incoming and outgoing, either though the headset or via the handset or speakerphone function. The phone may be inexpensive but it is what it is - a phone. Without all the bells and whistles that clog up a smartphone, this device does what it is supposed to and does it well. I bought two more as spares in case they every get discountinued. I do carry and use a smartphone for email and the web - but on calls, it is horrid and so I use this. Other people have said the call quality is not so great or it is cheap. I disagree. I carry this 24 hours a day, in all kinds of weather and conditions and it has never failed. And the battery life - long long long. 6 hours easily, sometimes more. It outlasts my more expensive Bluetooth headset.

Reviews.Title: Good Pay As You Go Phone
Reviews.Author: Zeke S.
Reviews.Content: I bought this back in December and I have to say it gets the job done. This phone is good for calls and text, that's it. If you want more features then your going to have to get a smart phone. This is a good basic phone, I can't stress that enough. My only complaint is that when you get picture messages you can't save the pics. I think AT&T; did this on intentionally because it is a pay as you go phone. Over all it's a great phone, my only gripe is that you can't save pics from picture messaging. If your looking for a good pay as you go phone this is it!

Reviews.Title: Good phone
Reviews.Author: Meghan Stephens "Meghan Stephens"
Reviews.Content: I can't afford the luxury phones and I have had this kind for about 10 years. This is my 2nd one. I think it works real good for the little amount of time I use it. Never have had any problems. (Just lost my 1st one in the tolet!)

Reviews.Title: Best basic flip phone available, BUT...
Reviews.Author: A. McClellan "Lint Man"
Reviews.Content: Pros: ringer is loud, speakerphone, call quality is great, Bluetooth, phone design is sturdy & thought out, battery life is very good, screen shows all important data like day/date/time placed nicely on both screens, no sneakily placed web function buttons like on the bad Nokia 6350 that I hate for many reasons.  The buttons and placement of certain function buttons on this phone, a197, are great!Cons: no video record function, low VGA quality camera, low available memory space 1MB, memory not expandable, no microSD slot to be found, only room for 199 contacts & limited saved txt msgs on phone due to low memory.I would have gave this phone 5 stars if there was a better camera, like 2MP, and had a micro SD slot to expand memory.Hey Samsung, a 4GB Micro SD card could hold a nice transferable address book, lots of pics & vids, even some personal folders saved from PC.  Aside from the lack of memory, this is a great phone.  The clam-shell design is very tight and sturdy.

Reviews.Title: Big improvement over old Nokia
Reviews.Author: Luv My Cats
Reviews.Content: Needed to upgrade pay-as-you-go phone to one w G3.  Now get reception in most areas of Bklyn and NYC.  It's good phone for peeps who don't need anything but the basics.

Reviews.Title: Good for first a couple of months and just gone bad
Reviews.Author: wlee
Reviews.Content: I've 3 of these and after a couple of months all of them just went bad... line dropping while talking after a few seconds. I am at the same spot / not moving and signal strength is good. No problem with the regular more expensive/contract ATT phone.

Reviews.Title: ok phone
Reviews.Author: R. Cardona
Reviews.Content: Nice,lite, instructions were concise--has more crap than I can use or want-should have got the a107.Battery life is about where advertised since i keep mine in stby mode most of the time.The drawback is sound quality--both receiving and talking--pretty low quality,garbled occassionally and speaker mode just as bad if not worse. But I paid $39 for it and got what I got.Wouldn't buy it again and I will listen to any other phone that I buy.

Reviews.Title: Airtime Credit Not Included
Reviews.Author: AuburnTygr
Reviews.Content: First let me say that I was not a current subscriber to AT&T; when I decided to purchase this phone.  I only wanted a cell phone for emergencies.  I'm not a big talker and do not have a need or desire to have a phone in my hands or at my ear all the time.  I do have health issues and wanted a cell phone to have with me on the road and so that my children could contact me anytime/place.I did the research and decided that this would be the most cost efficient phone for my needs.  As shown on the product page the included airtime was to be added to the phone upon activation.  I immediately went online and activated the phone upon receipt.  I was assigned a phone number and gave it to my family.  I charged the phone and placed in my purse almost forgetting that I had it.  After being told several times, by people who tried to call, that the calls were not going through I attempted to place a call.  The phone didn't work.  I received a couple of "Free" emails from AT&T; but no calls would go out or come through.  I signed in to my account and saw that my airtime balance was $0.00.  I contacted AT&T; after 7+ days of waiting to find out why the $15.00 airtime credit hadn't been applied.  AT&T; customer service couldn't or wouldn't provide an answer or the promised airtime-they just kept referring me to some other number or department.  I gave up and returned the phone.

Reviews.Title: 2G phone doesn't work with microcell
Reviews.Author: paparoma
Reviews.Content: I bought it as a GO phone but because it was only a 2G I sent it back. for this reason I bought Samsung Rugby 3g phone instead.

Reviews.Title: GoPhone
Reviews.Author: Lewis
Reviews.Content: I like the phone. It does everything it was said to do and does it well. If I have a complaint, it is that we die not get the $15.00 in free air time. That was for new AT&T; customers. We already had AT&T.; I wish that had ben said for new customers in the description.

Reviews.Title: Samsung phone
Reviews.Author: john m
Reviews.Content: I have used this phone for the last year or so and i have had no problems with the phone itself.I use PURETALK USA on a $10 a month plan with carry-over minutes and no contract which is great.The only real problem i have had is AT&T; is the carrier and their service is lousy.The phone itself is a basic phone and i only use it for calls and a text now and then.

Reviews.Title: Great phone at an affordable price !
Reviews.Author: Patricia
Reviews.Content: When I first read others reviews about this phone I was skeptic , because of some people saying the speaker phone , camera , and other things didn't work too well , I decided I would still buy it and try it because I have been looking for an affordable cellphone , which I don't use the speaker phone that much , and won't be using the camera that often so I wasn't worried about that .So after I received the phone and everything and tried it out , the speaker phone worked good , and so did the camera . I think it is a nice phone for someone who needs or is looking for a good affordable cellphone to have in case of emergency , it easy very easy to function , you don't have to press all kinds of different buttonsSo if you are looking for a cheap affordable phone this would be it and the $ 15.00 airtime will go on about in approximately about an hour after activating the phone , and you will receive a free text message letting you know that it was added . Like I said it is a great phone , if you want something simple .  :)

Reviews.Title: Nice phone, works great, but lacks in features
Reviews.Author: 360madden
Reviews.Content: For a bare bones cell phone it works well. the speakerphone works great but overall the phone lacks in some features. wish it was possible to edit contact list on PC then upload via USB but that specific feature isnt available.

Reviews.Title: Samsung a197 Prepaid Go Phone
Reviews.Author: Jeanette J: Ozimek
Reviews.Content: Product arrived as described and I was able to complete the set up from an online guide without needing a stop at the ATT store.

Reviews.Title: GOOD
Reviews.Author: sdnance48
Reviews.Content: A good phone, while it may not be a smart phone it is a good one and I am still using it.  In addition to the normal uses I find that I use the TIP calculator to make sure that I leave the correct amount when eating out.  This is a new item for me to be able to use.  Very happy.  I never used it as a GoPhone as I have a normal family talk account and my phone crashed.  This has worked for me for over 1 year.  Good phone.

Reviews.Title: Love it. Buying another.
Reviews.Author: Barely There "Never regret anything that made...
Reviews.Content: I'm a minimalist for cell phones. All I use it for is calling.  I've had the phone five months. Use it rarely. I love this Samsung A197 go phone. I got the phone for $30 with $15 free airtime in February. Major thanks to the reviews on Amazon. Based on your reviews I bought this phone in February 2011 and I have been very happy with it.I took phone "swimming" today (flipped my new kayak and did not have the protective bag sealed well enough.) The phone started vibrating. Not sure if I can dry it out...I am HOPEFULLY buying the same Samsung Phone to replace it. So July 2011 I am trying to buy a replacement Samsung A197 go phone.I consider this a cheap "go phone"...but it has been reliable and has nice features for my occasional use.The guy at phone store said a Blackberry micro charger will work with this phone.Phone comes with a nice small wall charger.

Reviews.Title: Good basic phone
Reviews.Author: Shocka "Jesus Cares about You"
Reviews.Content: Phone part works great, but the camera is low quality that produces very poor pictures. There is one glitch that Samsung told me can't be fixed: when you go to settings and change how you answer calls, you can change from the default setting of pushing the select button to answer a call to a new setting of flipping open the phone to answer the call. When the phone is turned off, the setting returns to the default setting.

Reviews.Title: Crashed SIM card!
Reviews.Author: followingHim
Reviews.Content: We bought the phone, inserting the SIM.  The SIM card crashed, and AT&T; charges $25 for a new SIM card.  Definitely would not recommend, unless the SIM card can be replaced without charge....

Reviews.Title: When Hope Is Gone...
Reviews.Author: Dario L. Herrera "Domino"
Reviews.Content: lol Im joking well my mother is not a tech freak like I am so when she needed a new phone this was my quickest way and lemme say she has not complained

Reviews.Title: product didnt work.
Reviews.Author: Jesse
Reviews.Content: I put the phone on the charger and when i go to put my sim card in and turn it on it is just a white screen. it doesn't work and now i have to hope that At&t; will exchange it.

Reviews.Title: Problems
Reviews.Author: G. Eric Hansen
Reviews.Content: Nothing but problems here, with the phone itself and AT&T.; The product arrived with two sets of Spanish instructions, but no quick start-up instructions. It took two people to figure out how to open the battery compartment. The numbers inside the phone literally could be read only with a magnifier. Set up with automated AT&T; line failed so I had to go to a customer rep, which succeeded in sending a signal to the phone, but I could not dial out. I gave up on it as a bad experiment.

Reviews.Title: Extremely disappointed
Reviews.Author: A Robertson
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed indeed. This phone was a gift to my dearest friends in the USA from a English person and when opened ALL instructions were in Spanish.Not on Samsung not all people speak Spanish and as these good people are senior citizens and as inam 6000 miles away it is going to be very awkward to get this phone up and running. No good sending it back either as they need a phone urgently. Unless you are fluent in Spanish DO NOT BUY THIS PHONE.

ProductInfo.Features:
Easy-to-use clamshell phone for voice communication and text messaging--includes $15 airtime credit with AT&T;'s GoPhone service
Pay for just the minutes you use with no annual contract--easy refill via Internet or prepaid cards
VGA camera for still photos; Bluetooth; speakerphone; access to personal e-mail and instant messaging services
Up to 6 hours of talk time, up to 300 hours (12.5 days) of standby time; released in September, 2010
What's in the Box: handset, rechargeable battery, charger, operating instructions, GoPhone SIM card
ProductInfo.Name: Samsung a197 Prepaid GoPhone (AT&T) with $15 Airtime Credit
